module.name: LCLClasses
module.short: Defines the base class for all LCL TComponents including controls

descr.p: SysUtils has a LongRec structure which uses an unsigned Word type for Lo and Hi. LazLongRec provides a similar record with signed SmallInt members.

element.name: LazLongRec.Lo
element.short: The low-order signed small integer value

element.name: LazLongRec.Hi
element.short: The high-order signed small integer value

element.name: TLCLComponent
element.short: The base class for LCL components which have an associated widget

descr.p: TLCLComponent is a TComponent descendant which is used as the ancestor for many components in the Lazarus Component Library (LCL), including:

element.name: TLCLComponent.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers this component class with the current WidgetSet

element.name: TLCLComponent.GetWSComponentClass
element.short: This method allows descendants to override the WidgetSetClass

descr.p: GetWSComponentClass is a TWSLCLComponentClass class function which allows descendants to override the WidgetSetClass class type used to create instances of the component. When WidgetSetClass has not been assigned (contains Nil), the return value is set to the TWSLCLComponent type.

element.name: TLCLComponent.GetWSComponentClass.Result
element.short: Class type used to create instances of the specified component

element.name: TLCLComponent.GetWSComponentClass.ASelf
element.short: Component instance examined in the method

element.name: TLCLComponent.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor. It also provides support for additional debugging information when DebugLCLComponents has been defined.

element.name: TLCLComponent.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TLCLComponent.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy provides support for additional debugging information when DebugLCLComponents has been defined. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TLCLComponent.NewInstance
element.short: Creates and registers a new instance of the class, and initializes the WidgetSetClass property

element.name: TLCLComponent.NewInstance.Result
element.short: Class instance created in the method

element.name: TLCLComponent.RemoveAllHandlersOfObject
element.short: Override this method to remove all references to notification handlers in AnObject

descr.p: An override is required as soon as a component allows one to add notification handlers. Then all such handlers must be removed, when their owner (AnObject) is destroyed.

element.name: TLCLComponent.RemoveAllHandlersOfObject.AnObject
element.short: The object whose handlers shall be removed

element.name: TLCLComponent.LCLRefCount
element.short: The number of references to this component

descr.p: LCLRefCount is a read-only Integer property that contains the number of references to this component. The value in LCLRefCount is updated when the IncLCLRefCount and DecLCLRefCount methods are called while handling messages where the component instance is the target.

element.name: TLCLComponent.WidgetSetClass
element.short: The class type used to create instances of this component

descr.p: WidgetSetClass is a read-only TWSLCLComponentClass property which contains the class type used to create new instances of the component. The value for the property is set in the NewInstance method.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent
element.short: Base class for all components having an associated widget with a handle

descr.p: The widget is created by the LCL control whenever required, and its reference is stored in the FReferencePtr member. This reference is for internal use by the LCL control, and not by application code.
This reference is different from the OS/window manager-specific window Handle.
Applications only can send messages to a windowed control, using its window Handle.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.FReferencePtr
element.short: Pointer to a widget class Reference

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.FCreating
element.short: Set while we are creating the Reference

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.GetReferenceAllocated
element.short: Checks for a valid widget reference

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.CreateParams
element.short: Override this method to supply specific widget creation parameters

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.CreateParams.AParams
element.short: The parameter record to update

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.DestroyReference
element.short: Destroys the reference object

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.GetReferenceHandle
element.short: Override this method to return the Handle from the reference

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceCreated
element.short: Called after the Reference is created

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceDestroying
element.short: Called before the Reference is destroyed

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceNeeded
element.short: Creates a Reference, if not already done

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.WSCreateReference
element.short: Tells the widgetset to create a Reference
element.descr: This implementation returns Nil, and should be overridden in derived classes.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.WSDestroyReference
element.short: Tells the widgetset to destroy the Reference

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls DestroyReference to release an assigned internal reference for the widgetset class. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TLCLReferenceComponent.ReferenceAllocated
element.short: If True, a Reference has been allocated for this component
